Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 58th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1981...
Injured on 5/22/1983 with a Tight Shoulder, out for 3 days...
Injured on 7/1/1983 with a Blister On Finger, out for 4 days...
Injured on 8/11/1983 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 5/26/1984, off John Martin (DET)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/14/1984, off Larry Yount (CAL)...
Injured on 4/9/1986 with a Sore Back, out for 1-2 weeks...
Drove in 7 runs against Baltimore on 4/26/1986...
Injured on 7/14/1987 with a Strained Elbow Ligament, out for one week...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/5/1988, hitting .609 with 0 HR, 6 RBI...
Won World Series with Minnesota in 1988...
Signed as a free agent by St. Louis on 2/11/1990 to a 5-year deal worth $15,950,000 per year...
Had 5 hits with 5 RBI against Pittsburgh on 5/18/1992...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/19/1992, hitting .478 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Was selected to the 1993 Allstar game...
Injured on 9/4/1993 with a Inflamed Tricep Tendon, out for 3 weeks...
Won World Series with St. Louis in 1993...
Signed as a free agent by Pittsburgh on 2/11/1995 to a 2-year deal worth $6,500,000 per year...
